definition: to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: Babysitting is a rite of passage for many girls in junior high school.
sentences.chinese: 看護兒童是很多在初中的女孩經歷的習俗。

sentences.english: Plus, they are less trouble to their families and caretakers.
sentences.chinese: 何況他們也給家庭和看護者帶來更少麻煩。

sentences.english: Teachers often chaperon their classes on field trips.
sentences.chinese: 在野外郊遊時老師常看護着班上的學生。

sentences.english: Our guest center provides baby-sitting services.
sentences.chinese: 我們房務中心提供嬰兒看護服務。

sentences.english: I adopted my son from the US foster care system when he was 10-years-old.
sentences.chinese: 我從應用看護體制領養我兒子時，我兒子才10歲。

sentences.english: Maturing love takes on the form of companionship and caregiving.
sentences.chinese: 成熟的愛是以相守和相互看護的形式表現。

sentences.english: Of course money can get him the best health care possible but no money can buy insurance for a life.
sentences.chinese: 當然錢可以給他最好的醫療看護但不能保證活命。

sentences.english: Kings and bears often worry their keepers.
sentences.chinese: 國王與熊常讓看護人擔憂。

sentences.english: Slumber now, fiery Lords, nursed by the ageless Night.
sentences.chinese: 沉眠吧，疲憊的主人們，在永恆的夜的看護下。

sentences.english: Perriman , the keeper of central chair told the television station in new zealand.
sentences.chinese: 中心首席看護員林登佩裏曼告訴新西蘭電視臺。

sentences.english: Keepers said the pandas were in good condition.
sentences.chinese: 看護人說熊貓的各方面情況很好。

sentences.english: Being a teenager whose parents have handed him or her to the care of the state must be intensely disturbing.
sentences.chinese: 被父母送到州內去看護的青少年一定感覺很煩擾。

sentences.english: Each of us was assigned a minder, someone who looked after us.
sentences.chinese: 我們每個人都被派了一個看護人來照顧我們。

sentences.english: Residents gather for a morning prayer.
sentences.chinese: 看護之家的成員們聚在一起做晨間禱告。

sentences.english: When my caretakers step here they become irate.
sentences.chinese: 我的看護人一站上這裏就開始生氣。

sentences.english: Teachers often chaperon their classes on field trips.
sentences.chinese: 在野外郊遊時教員常看護着班上的學生。

definition: to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
unable to move freely/difficult to get about
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
business in which a company has traditionally engaged (e.g. before diversifying)/original business/core business/(literary) agriculture
